info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer is a nitrocellulose, solvent-based, high-gloss lacquer type paint that is easy to apply and dries rapidly to a durable, attractive finish.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is ideal for interior wooden surfaces such as doors, jambs, cabinets, and shelves and metal substrates.

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: If necessary, add approximately 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 to the ready-to-use mixture.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.body: Sand surface until wood is smooth to the touch. Hammer all nails deep enough to apply BOYSEN®® Lacquer Spot Putty B‑306. Dust off surfaces completely then wipe with a clean rag. If repainting, remove all paint by using manual or mechanical methods prior to the application of BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
info.body: 1st coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305 Putty: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Spot Putty B‑306 2nd coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305 on puttied areas Final coat: BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer B‑1300 in required number of coats

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Metal Surfaces
info.body: 1st coat: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer 2nd & 3rd coat: BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer B‑1300 in required number of coats
